title: Do you know what font type is it? need to develop an OCR application for vehicle registration certificate. Thanks
author: mikanen

comments.content:
Most inkjet/dot matrix typefaces are specific to the equipment that produces them.

Save for having a zero with a diagonal slash, Chunkfeeder mimics the look nicely:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeco/chunkfeeder/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115010/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeco/chunkfeeder/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeco/chunkfeeder/")

Your image shows a dot matrix typeface on fairly fine grid that is similar to the 10 by 14 grid on Pexico by Ondrej Jób. Differences in specific letters and numbers could be edited for a precise match

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115010im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Pexico_VehicleRegistration1_5156.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115010im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Pexico_VehicleRegistration2_3598.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115010im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Pexico_VehicleRegistration3_5424.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115010im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Pexico_VehicleRegistration4_4660.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115010im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Pexico_VehicleRegistration5_5373.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115010im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Pexico_VehicleRegistration6_4497.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115010im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Pexico_VehicleRegistration8_5001.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urtd/pexico/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115010/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urtd/pexico/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urtd/pexico/")  
Don
